Elon Musk confirms that the explosion was caused by fireworks in the bed of the rental Cybertruck, which had no faults, according to data.

A Tesla Cybertruck exploded Wednesday outside of the Trump Tower in Las Vegas, Nevada, in what officials are calling a "possible act of terror."

An official investigating the situation said the driver of the Cybertruck reportedly pulled into the valet area before the vehicle exploded, killing the driver and injuring seven bystanders.

The Cybertruck was filled with fireworks or other explosives

The cause of the explosion has yet to be officially determined by authorities, although according to early ABC News coverage of the incident, the truck was filled with fireworks-style mortars.

Elon Musk wrote in an X (formerly Twitter) post that his senior team is also investigating the matter and confirmed that fireworks or a bomb in the bed of the Cybertruck caused the explosion. The truck was reportedly a Turo rental out of Colorado, and no mechanical faults were reported, according to onboard telemetry.

Surveillance footage posted on X shows the exploding Cybertruck and the corresponding fireworks surrounding the blast area immediately afterward.

Elon Musk will play a sizable role in Donald Trump's administration

Elon was recently assigned to the incoming Trump administration's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Alongside fellow entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy, the pair have been tasked with advising the administration on how to best cut excess government spending.

At a news conference, Las Vegas Sheriff Kevin McMahill said that there is no further threat to the community but recognized the potential political implications.

“But obviously, a Cybertruck, the Trump hotel – there’s lots of questions that we have to answer as we move forward.”

Eric Trump, Donald Trump's son and the executive vice president of the Trump Organization, also posted about the incident on X. Donald Trump himself has yet to make his own post.

Final thoughts

No other information is currently available about the driver's background or their motives. As this is a breaking news story, we will update this article as more information is released by the corresponding authorities.
